tit.e: Tenchi Kaibyaku (creation of heaven and earth)
Tenchi Kaibyaku (creation of heaven and earth)

sen.j: 天地開闢（てんちかいびゃく）とは、天地に代表される世界が、初めて生まれた時のことを示す。
sen.e: Tenchikaibyaku is a time when the world represented by heaven and earth was first created.
Tenchi Kaibyaku is a time when the world represented by heaven and earth was first created.
Tenchi Kaibyaku is a time when the world represented by heaven and earth was first created.

sen.j: 狭義には、『日本書紀』冒頭の「古（いにしえ）に天地未だ剖（わか）れず、陰陽分れざりしとき......」を言う。
sen.e: In a narrow sense, it refers to the opening line of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan): 'Long, long ago, when the heaven and the earth were not separated yet, and light and darkness were not distinguished….'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In a narrow sense, it refers to the opening line of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan): 'Long, long ago, when the heaven and the earth were not separated yet, and light and darkness were not distinguished...'

In a narrow sense, it refers to the opening line of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan): 'Long, long ago, when the heaven and the earth were not separated yet, and light and darkness were not distinguished...'

sen.j: しかし、この記事では、広義の日本神話における天地開闢・国土創造のシーンについて記す。
sen.e: In this article, however, the wide meaning of Tenchikaigyaku in the Japanese myths and creation of Japan will be treated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this article, however, the wide meaning of Tenchi Kaibyaku in the Japanese myths and creation of Japan will be treated.
In this article, however, the wide meaning of Tenchi Kaibyaku in the Japanese myths and creation of Japan will be treated.

sen.j: 中国神話における天地開闢は天地開闢 (中国)を、キリスト教の旧約聖書の創世記におけるものについては天地創造を参照。
sen.e: See the article of Tenchikaigyaku (China) to know Tenchikaigyaku in the Chinese myths, and see the article of the Creation to know about Genesis in the Christian Old Testament.
See the article of Tenchi Kaibyaku (China) to know Tenchi Kaibyaku in the Chinese myths, and see the article of the Creation to know about Genesis in the Christian Old Testament.
See the article of Tenchi Kaibyaku (China) to know Tenchi Kaibyaku in the Chinese myths, and see the article of the Creation to know about Genesis in the Christian Old Testament.

sen.j: 自分達の世界がどのようにして生まれたか。
sen.e: How was our world created?
How was our world created?
How was our world created?

sen.j: このことは、古代人にとっても大きな問題であった。
sen.e: It was a big problem to the ancient people, too.
It was a big problem to the ancient people, too.
It was a big problem to the ancient people, too.

sen.j: 『古事記』・『日本書紀』の最初の部分は、世界誕生の頃の物語となっている。
sen.e: The opening parts of "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" are tales which tell us around the time when the world was born.
The opening parts of "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" are tales which tell us around the time when the world was born.
The opening parts of "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" are tales which tell us around the time when the world was born.

sen.j: しかし、『古事記』と『日本書紀』との間で、物語の内容は相当に異なる。
sen.e: However, the contents of "Kojiki" and "Nihonshoki" are quite different.
However, the contents of "Kojiki" and "Nihonshoki" are quite different.
However, the contents of "Kojiki" and "Nihonshoki" are quite different.

sen.j: またさらに、『日本書紀』の中でも、「本書」といわれる部分の他に、「一書」と呼ばれる異説の部分がある。
sen.e: Furthermore, "Nihonshoki" contains a different tale called 'alternate writing' in addition to the tale called 'the main text.'
Furthermore, "Nihonshoki" contains a different tale called 'arufumi' (alternate writing) in addition to the tale called 'honjo' (the main text).
Furthermore, "Nihonshoki" contains a different tale called 'arufumi' (alternate writing) in addition to the tale called 'honjo' (the main text).

sen.j: このようにして、世界誕生の神話は1つに定まっていない。
sen.e: So there are several myths about the birth of this world.
So there are several myths about the birth of this world.
So there are several myths about the birth of this world.

sen.j: あらすじ
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 『古事記』
sen.e: "Kojiki"
"Kojiki"
"Kojiki"

sen.j: 『古事記』によれば、世界の始った直後は次のようであった。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki," the time when the world was just created was as follows.
According to "Kojiki," the time when the world was just created was as follows.
According to "Kojiki," the time when the world was just created was as follows.

sen.j: 『古事記』の「天地初発之時」（あめつちのはじめのとき）という冒頭は天と地となって動き始めた時であり、天地がいかに創造されたかを語ってはいない。
sen.e: The opening line of "Kojiki," 'Ame tsuchi no hajime no toki,' refers to the time when the heaven and the earth first appeared, and it does not tell how the heaven and the earth was created.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ame Tsuchi no hajime no toki' (when the heaven and earth) in the opening line of "Kojiki" refers to the time when the heaven and the earth first appeared, and it does not tell how they were created.
Ame Tsuchi no hajime no toki' (when the heaven and earth) in the opening line of "Kojiki" refers to the time when the heaven and the earth first appeared, and it does not tell how they were created.

sen.j: しかし、一般的には日本神話における天地開闢のシーンと言えば、近代以降は『古事記』のこのシーンが想起される。
sen.e: Speaking of the scene of Tenchikaibyaku in the Japanese mythology, it generally refers to this scene of "Kojiki" after the modern times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Speaking of the scene of Tenchi Kaibyaku in the Japanese mythology, it generally refers to this scene of "Kojiki" after the modern times.
Speaking of the scene of Tenchi Kaibyaku in the Japanese mythology, it generally refers to this scene of "Kojiki" after the modern times.

sen.j: 神話研究における「天地開闢」は次節の『天地開闢 (日本神話)』参照。
sen.e: See the next article of "Tenchikaibyaku (Japanese mythology)" to know about 'Tenchikaibyaku' in the study of mythology.
For the detail about 'Tenchi Kaibyaku' in the study of mythology, see the next article of "Tenchi Kaibyaku" (Japanese mythology).
For the detail about 'Tenchi Kaibyaku' in the study of mythology, see the next article of "Tenchi Kaibyaku" (Japanese mythology).

sen.j: 世界の最初に、高天原に相次いで三柱の神（造化の三神）が生まれた。
sen.e: At the beginning of the world, three gods (The Three Gods of Creation) were born one after another in Takamanohara (plain of high heaven).
At the beginning of the world, three gods (The Three Gods of Creation) were born one after another in Takamanohara (plain of high heaven).
At the beginning of the world, three gods (The Three Gods of Creation) were born one after another in Takamanohara (plain of high heaven).

sen.j: 天之御中主神 （あめのみなかぬしのかみ）
sen.e: Ame no Minakanushi no Kami (one of the gods in Japanese mythology)
Ame no Minakanushi no Kami
sen.cmt: 用語補足を修正しました。
sen.e: Ame no Minakanushi no Kami

sen.j: 高御産巣日神 （たかみむすひのかみ）
sen.e: Takamimusubi (Takami Musuhi no Kami) (one of the gods in Japanese mythology)
Takami Musuhi no Kami
sen.cmt: 原文には 「タカミムスビ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「高御産巣日神」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Takami Musuhi no Kami

sen.j: 神産巣日神 （かみむすひのかみ）
sen.e: Kamimusubi (Kami Musuhi no Kami) (one of the gods in Japanese mythology)
Kami Musuhi no Kami
sen.cmt: 原文には 「カミムスビ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「神産巣日神」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Kami Musuhi no Kami

sen.j: 続いて、二柱の神が生まれた。
sen.e: Then two gods were born.
Then another two gods were born.
Then another two gods were born.

sen.j: 宇摩志阿斯訶備比古遅神 （うましあしかびひこぢのかみ）
sen.e: Umashiashikabihikoji (Umashiashikabihikoji no Kami) (one of the gods in Japanese mythology)
Umashi ashikabi hikoji no Kami
sen.cmt: 原文には 「ウマシアシカビヒコヂ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「宇摩志阿斯訶備比古遅神」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Umashi ashikabi hikoji no Kami

sen.j: 天之常立神 （あめのとこたちのかみ）
sen.e: Ame no Tokotachi no Kami (one of the gods in Japanese mythology)
Ame no Tokotachi no Kami
sen.cmt: 用語補足を削除しました。
sen.e: Ame no Tokotachi no Kami

sen.j: この五柱の神は、特に性別はなく、独身のままに子どもを生まずに身を隠してしまった。
sen.e: These five gods did not have certain sex, and they hided away without getting married and giving birth to children.
These five gods did not have certain sex, and they hide away without getting married and giving birth to children.
These five gods did not have certain sex, and they hide away without getting married and giving birth to children.

sen.j: それゆえに、これ以降表だって神話には登場しないが、根元的な影響力を持つ特別な神である。
sen.e: Therefore they did not visibly appear in the myth, but they were special gods that had fundamental influences.
Therefore they did not visibly appear in the myth, but they were special gods that had fundamental influences.
Therefore they did not visibly appear in the myth, but they were special gods that had fundamental influences.

sen.j: そのため別天神（ことあまつかみ）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: That is why they are called Koto Amatsu Kami (Separate heavenly kami).
That is why they are called Koto Amatsu Kami (Separate heavenly kami).
That is why they are called Koto Amatsu Kami (Separate heavenly kami).

sen.j: 次に、また二柱の神が生まれた。
sen.e: Then two gods were born again.
Then another two gods were born.
Then another two gods were born.

sen.j: 国之常立神 （くにのとこたちのかみ）
sen.e: Kuni no Tokotachi no Kami (eternal god of the land)
Kuni no Tokotachi no Kami (eternal god of the land)
Kuni no Tokotachi no Kami (eternal god of the land)

sen.j: 豊雲野神 （とよくもののかみ）
sen.e: Toyokumo no Kami (one of the gods in Japanese mythology)
Toyokumo no Kami
sen.cmt: 原文には 「トヨクモノ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「豊雲野神」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Toyokumo no Kami

sen.j: 国之常立神と豊雲野神もまた性別はなく、またこれ以降神話には登場しない。
sen.e: Kuni no Tokotachi no Kami and Toyokumo no Kami also did not have sex, and they did not appear in the myth after that.
Kuni no Tokotachi no Kami and Toyokumo no Kami also did not have sex, and they did not appear in the myth after that.
Kuni no Tokotachi no Kami and Toyokumo no Kami also did not have sex, and they did not appear in the myth after that.

sen.j: これに引き続いて、五組十柱の神々が生まれた。
sen.e: Then ten gods (five pairs) were born.
Subsequently, 10 gods of five pairs were born.
Subsequently, 10 gods of five pairs were born.

sen.j: 五組の神々は、それぞれ男女の対の神々であり、下のリストでは、左側が男性神、右側が女性神となっている。
sen.e: These five pairs of gods were couples of male and female gods respectively, and in the following list, the left is a male god, and the right is a female god.
These five pairs of gods were couples of male and female gods respectively, and in the following list, the left is a male god, and the right is a female god.
These five pairs of gods were couples of male and female gods respectively, and in the following list, the left is a male god, and the right is a female god.

sen.j: 宇比地邇神 （うひぢにのかみ）、須比智邇神 （すひぢにのかみ）
sen.e: Uhijini/Suhijini (Uhijini no Kami), (Suhijini no kami)
Uhijini no Kami, Suhijini no Kami
sen.cmt: 原文には 「ウヒヂニ・スヒヂニ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「宇比地邇神」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Uhijini no Kami, Suhijini no Kami

sen.j: 角杙神 （つのぐひのかみ）、活杙神 （いくぐひのかみ）
sen.e: Tsunugui/Ikugui (Tsunoguhi no Kami), (Ikuguhi no Kami)
Tsunoguhi no Kami, Ikuguhi no Kami
sen.cmt: 原文には 「ツヌグイ・イクグイ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「角杙神」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Tsunoguhi no Kami, Ikuguhi no Kami

sen.j: 意富斗能地神 （おほとのじのかみ）、大斗乃弁神 （おほとのべのかみ）
sen.e: Otonoji/Otonobe (Otoji no Kami), (Otonobe no Kami)
Otoji no Kami, Otonobe no Kami
sen.cmt: 原文には 「オオトノヂ・オオトノベ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「意富斗能地神」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Otoji no Kami, Otonobe no Kami

sen.j: 於母陀流神 （おもだるのかみ）、阿夜訶志古泥神 （あやかしこねのかみ）
sen.e: Omodaru/Ayakashikone (Omodaru no Kami), (Ayakashikone no Kami)
Omodaru no Kami, Ayakashikone no Kami
sen.cmt: 原文には 「オモダル・アヤカシコネ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「於母陀流神」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Omodaru no Kami, Ayakashikone no Kami

sen.j: 伊邪那岐神 （いざなぎのかみ）、伊邪那美神 （いざなみのかみ）
sen.e: Izanagi no Kami, Izanami no Kami
Izanagi no Kami, Izanami no Kami
sen.cmt: 原文には 「イザナギ」「イザナミ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「伊邪那岐神」「伊邪那美神」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: Izanagi no Kami, Izanami no Kami

sen.j: 以上の七組十二柱の神々を総称して神世七代（かみのよななよ）という。
sen.e: These twelve gods (seven pairs) mentioned above are generically called Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven).
These 12 gods of seven pairs previously mentioned are generically called Kaminoyo Nanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven).
These 12 gods of seven pairs previously mentioned are generically called Kaminoyo Nanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven).

sen.j: 『日本書紀』
sen.e: "Nihonshoki"
"Nihonshoki"
"Nihonshoki"

sen.j: 『日本書紀』における天地開闢は渾沌が陰陽に分離して天地と成ったという世界認識が語られる。
sen.e: Tenchikaibyaku in "Nihonshoki" tells us how the world was created; chaos was separated into light and darkness, and became the heaven and the earth.
Tenchi Kaibyaku in "Nihonshoki" tells us how the world was created; chaos was separated into light and darkness to become the heaven and the earth.
Tenchi Kaibyaku in "Nihonshoki" tells us how the world was created; chaos was separated into light and darkness to become the heaven and the earth.

sen.j: 続いてのシーンは、性別のない神々の登場のシーン（巻一第一段）と男女の別れた神々の登場のシーン（巻一第二段・第三段）に分かれる。
sen.e: The following scene is that gods without sex appear (vol.1, the first section), and then male and female gods appear (vol.1, the second and the third sections).
The following scene is that gods without sex appear (the first section of the First Volume), and then male and female gods appear (the second and the third sections of the Volume First Volume).
The following scene is that gods without sex appear (the first section of the First Volume), and then male and female gods appear (the second and the third sections of the Volume First Volume).

sen.j: また、先にも述べたように、古事記と内容が相当違う。
sen.e: As it was mentioned above, the contents are quite different from those of Kojiki.
As it was previously mentioned, the contents are quite different from those of Kojiki.
As it was previously mentioned, the contents are quite different from those of Kojiki.

sen.j: さらに異説も存在する。
sen.e: Moreover, a different tale also exists.
Moreover, different tales also exist.
Moreover, different tales also exist.

sen.j: 根源神たちの登場
sen.e: Appearance of the gods of the foundation of the land
Appearance of the gods of the foundation of the land
Appearance of the gods of the foundation of the land

sen.j: 本書によれば、太古、天と地とは分かれておらず、互いに混ざり合って混沌とした状況にあった。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki," in ancient times, the heaven and the earth were not separated, and they were mixed together, being in a state of chaos.
According to the "Nihonshoki," in ancient times, the heaven and the earth were not separated, and they were mixed together, being in a state of chaos.
According to the "Nihonshoki," in ancient times, the heaven and the earth were not separated, and they were mixed together, being in a state of chaos.

sen.j: しかし、その混沌としたものの中から、清浄なものは上昇して天となり、重く濁ったものは大地となった。
sen.e: From the chaotic state, however, immaculate things went up and became the heaven, while heavy and muddy things became the earth.
From the chaotic state, however, immaculate things went up and became the heaven, while heavy and muddy things became the earth.
From the chaotic state, however, immaculate things went up and became the heaven, while heavy and muddy things became the earth.

sen.j: そして、その中から、神が生まれるのである。
sen.e: Then gods were born among them.
Then gods were born among them.
Then gods were born among them.

sen.j: 天地の中に葦の芽のようなものが生成された。
sen.e: Something like a reed was generated between the heaven and the earth.
Something like reeds were generated in the heaven and the earth.
Something like reeds were generated in the heaven and the earth.

sen.j: これが、神となる。
sen.e: It became gods.
They became gods.
They became gods.

sen.cmt: 原文には 「トヨクモノ」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「豊斟渟尊」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。

sen.j: これらの神々には、性別がなかった。
sen.e: These gods did not have sex.

sen.j: 第1の一書によれば、天地の中に生成されたものの形は不明である。
sen.e: According to the first 'alternate writing,' the shapes generated between the heaven and the earth were unknown.
In the arufumi of the First Volume, the shapes generated between the heaven and the earth were unknown.

sen.j: しかし、これが神となったことは変わらない。
sen.e: However, it is the same that they became the gods.
However, it is the same that they became the gods.
However, it is the same that they became the gods.

sen.j: 生まれた神々は次の通りである。
sen.e: The gods coming into existence are as follows.
The gods coming into existence were as follows.

sen.j: すなわち、本書と同じ内容であるが、神々の名称が異なる。
sen.e: That is to say, the contents is the same as those of 'the main text,' but names of the gods are different.
That is to say, the contents is the same as those of the honjo, but names of the gods are different.

sen.j: 男女一対神たちの登場
sen.e: Appearance of pairs of male and female gods
Appearance of pairs of male and female gods
Appearance of pairs of male and female gods

sen.j: 渾沌から天地がわかれ、性別のない神々が生まれたあと、男女の別のある神々が生まれることとなる。
sen.e: After the heaven and the earth were separated from chaos, gods without sex were born, then gods with sex came into existence.
After the heaven and the earth were separated from chaos, gods without sex were born, and then gods with sex came into existence.
After the heaven and the earth were separated from chaos, gods without sex were born, and then gods with sex came into existence.

sen.j: これらの神々の血縁関係は、本書では記されていないが、一書の中には異伝として、記されている。
sen.e: Blood relations of these gods were not written in the main text, but the alternate writing contains them as a different tale.
Blood relations of these gods were not written in the honjo, but the arufumi writings contains them as a variant version.
Blood relations of these gods were not written in the honjo, but the arufumi writings contains them as a variant version.

sen.j: 本書によれば、四組八柱の神々が生まれた。
sen.e: According to the main text, four pairs of eight gods were born.
According to the honjo, four pairs of eight gods were born.
According to the honjo, four pairs of eight gods were born.

sen.j: 四組の神々は、それぞれ男女の対の神々であり、下のリストでは、左側が男性神、右側が女性神となっている。
sen.e: These four pairs consisted of male and female gods, and in the following list, the left is male god and the right is female god.
These four pairs consisted of male and female gods, and in the following list, the left is male god and the right is female god.
These four pairs consisted of male and female gods, and in the following list, the left is male god and the right is female god.

sen.j: 第1の一書では、伊弉諾尊、伊弉冉尊は、青橿城根尊の子とされている。
sen.e: In the first alternate writing, Izanagi no Mikoto and Izanami no Mikoto were considered sons of Aokashiki no Mikoto.

sen.j: さて、本書によれば、国常立尊・国狭槌尊・豊斟渟尊に、以上の四組八柱の神々を加えたものを総称して神世七代という。
sen.e: The main text tells us that Kuni no Tokotachi no Mikoto, Kuni no Satasuchi no Mikoto, Toyokumunu no Mikoto, and the above four pairs of eight gods were generically called Kaminoyonanayo.
The honjo tells us that Kuni no Tokotachi no Mikoto, Kuni no Satsuchi no Mikoto, Toyokumunu no Mikoto, and the above four pairs of eight gods were generically called Kaminoyo Nanayo.
The honjo tells us that Kuni no Tokotachi no Mikoto, Kuni no Satsuchi no Mikoto, Toyokumunu no Mikoto, and the above four pairs of eight gods were generically called Kaminoyo Nanayo.

sen.j: 第1の一書によれば、四組八柱の神々の名が異なっている。

According to the arufumi of the First Volume, the names of four pairs of eight gods are different.

sen.j: 中国思想の影響
sen.e: Influence of Chinese thought
Influence of Chinese Thought
Influence of Chinese Thought

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の冒頭「古（いにしえ）に天地未だ剖（わか）れず、陰陽分れざりしとき......」。は中国の古典の『淮南子』の「天地未だ剖（わか）れず、陰陽未だ判（わか）れず、四時未だ分れず、萬物未だ生ぜず......」によっている。
sen.e: The opening line of "Nihonshoki," 'Long, long ago, when the heaven and the earth were not separated yet, and light and darkness were not distinguished….' was derived from Chinese classic, "Huainanzi" (The Masters/Philosophers of Huainan), 'The heaven and the earth were not separated yet; light and darkness were not distinguished yet; the four seasons were not separated yet; all things were not generated yet....'
sen.cmt: ２つに分かれていた列を統合しました。
sen.e: The opening line of "Nihonshoki," 'Long, long ago, when the heaven and the earth were not separated yet, and light and darkness were not distinguished...' was derived from 'The heaven and the earth were not separated yet; light and darkness were not distinguished yet; the four seasons were not separated yet; all things were not generated yet....' of a Chinese classic, "Huainanzi" (The Masters/Philosophers of Huainan).

The opening line of "Nihonshoki," 'Long, long ago, when the heaven and the earth were not separated yet, and light and darkness were not distinguished...' was derived from 'The heaven and the earth were not separated yet; light and darkness were not distinguished yet; the four seasons were not separated yet; all things were not generated yet....' of a Chinese classic, "Huainanzi" (The Masters/Philosophers of Huainan).
